dismissalText.commentary: AB de Villiers run out (Benn) 70 (80b 2x4 1x6 113m) SR: 87.5

dismissalComment.html: well done, big man! de Villiers punches a full delivery past the bowler and down to long-off, de Villiers jogs the first run, isn't sure of the second,  Steyn steps out of his crease for the second run but there's no communication, de Villiers too ambles out of his crease, then turns around but it was too late as Benn's throw shattered the middle stump

dismissalText.commentary: Hashim Amla b Benn 34 (28b 5x4 0x6 42m) SR: 121.42

dismissalComment.html: chopped it on! Tossed up outside off, the ball skids on and Amla expects it to turn as he shapes to cut through the off side, he gets a inside edge on to the stumps

dismissalComment.html: that drop didn't cost anything! Pollard pitches it up outside off and McLaren gets forward and ends up spooning it low to Richards at short cover

dismissalComment.html: SA in danger of not playing out 50 overs here, Morkel plays a front-foot pull over midwicket and nearly clears the rope, Darren Bravo jogs to his left and takes it comfortably but inches from the rope

dismissalComment.html: chopped it on! Tossed up outside off, the ball skids on and Amla expects it to turn as he shapes to cut through the off side, he gets a inside edge on to the stumps

headshotImage.caption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Jacques Kallis player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: just a hint of doubt whether Sammy was in control of the ball long enough after taking the catch, Kallis cuts it on the up towards Sammy at point, the ball travels low and Sammy picks it inches off the turf, he caught it alright but he pushed the ball away after a couple of seconds, not exactly Gibbs in the 1999 World Cup but it looked clean enough on seeing the replay, Kallis lurked around for a few seconds and glanced at the umpire, he was prepared to walk and the umpire just checked with Sammy once again if it was clean - no arguments, settled

dismissalText.commentary: Graeme Smith lbw b DJ Bravo 29 (41b 1x4 0x6 76m) SR: 70.73

dismissalComment.html: Smith takes a middle stump guard and exposes his leg stump, Bravo bowls a yorker on the leg stump line and Smith fails to deflect it away to fine leg, the ball hits the base of the pad and Harper gives it out

dismissalText.commentary: Dale Richards c Kallis b Morkel 28 (30b 3x4 1x6 51m) SR: 93.33

dismissalComment.html: that was plumb! Morkel comes round the wicket and fires it on a good length, Bravo's beaten for pace and the ball thuds his pads in front of middle, easy one for Harper

headshotImage.longCaption: SJ Benn headshot

dismissalComment.html: this time he finally connects but doesn't get the elevation over midwicket and McLaren does well to run forward from deep midwicket and takes it on the fall

headshotImage.caption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021
headshotImage.longCaption: Ravi Rampaul player page headshot cutout, 2021

dismissalComment.html: formalities are over and South Africa have won the series! Rampaul backs away and gets a top edge over cover, Botha runs backwards and takes the catch comfortably

dismissalComment.html: West Indies are losing the plot fast, Langeveldt fires it in full and fast outside off, Sammy shapes to drive, the bat hits the ground and the ball takes the outside edge close to the toe of the bat, de Villiers moves to his right and takes it

commentTextItems.html: formalities are over and South Africa have won the series! Rampaul backs away and gets a top edge over cover, Botha runs backwards and takes the catch comfortably

commentPostTextItems.html: Five matches down and West Indies cannot win a game. They have several reasons to be peeved with themselves. The bowlers did all the hard work of restricting SA to 224 but the batsmen lost the game because of themselves, more than SA's efficiency in the field. Poor shots contributed to most of the dismissals and that explains why the innings didn't even cross 40 overs.

I will refer to what Ian Bishop said today on commentary about Gayle's responsibilities as a captain and opening batsman. His contributions have a huge bearing on the result and if he can minimise the risks and focus more on batting through the innings, West Indies will win more games. If he wants to lead from the front, he has to change his approach and allow others to bat around him. It's not the end of the world if Gayle cuts down on some of his shots. The scoring rate can still be healthy. This is a team game, remember?
Nevertheless, SA were the deserved winners and congratulations to them. The presentation has begun.

Gayle: "Restricting them was a good effort. We need to work on our batting. Two games to go, we need to improve. A lot of guys look up to me to give the starts but if I can't then someone else will have to put his hand up."

Smith: "We knew the wicket was two-paced, we let ourselves down in the last 20 overs. The bowlers kept the intensity and it was their win. It worked when we hit the deck hard. Some of the guys have played a lot so far so we might see who needs a break. I feel like a breakthrough innings from me is around the corner."
AB de Villiers is the Man of the Match: "I'm enjoying batting at 4, making sure I bat as many overs as possible. It's important for the team for me to keep at the moment. I kept a lot better today."
Thanks for your company today and the mails. Join us for the fourth ODI on Sunday at the same venue. It's goodbye from all of us here.

dismissalText.commentary: Jacques Kallis c Sammy b Benn 31 (41b 2x4 1x6 54m) SR: 75.6

dismissalComment.html: just a hint of doubt whether Sammy was in control of the ball long enough after taking the catch, Kallis cuts it on the up towards Sammy at point, the ball travels low and Sammy picks it inches off the turf, he caught it alright but he pushed the ball away after a couple of seconds, not exactly Gibbs in the 1999 World Cup but it looked clean enough on seeing the replay, Kallis lurked around for a few seconds and glanced at the umpire, he was prepared to walk and the umpire just checked with Sammy once again if it was clean - no arguments, settled

South Africa: 100 runs in 18.5 overs (113 balls), Extras 1

J Botha retired hurt on 15* from 197/5 (39.5 ov) to 207/8 (43.6 ov)

stories.title: West Indies gave up too easily
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: West Indies gave up too easily
stories.summary: It is now impossible to see the West Indies recovering the spirit and confidence needed to challenge these South Africans in the remaining two ODIs and three Tests

image.caption: The West Indians go for a jog
image.longCaption: The West Indians go for a jog, Antigua, May 18 2010

stories.title: 'Aggressive bowling won it for SA' - Graeme Smith
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: 'Aggressive bowling won it for SA' - Graeme Smith
stories.summary: Graeme Smith, the South Africa captain, has singled out his team's aggressive bowling as the factor that clinched a 67-run win in Dominica for the visitors and enabled them to take an unassailable 3-0 lead in the five-match series

image.caption: AB de Villiers salutes the crowd on reaching his half-century
image.longCaption: AB de Villiers salutes the crowd on reaching his half-century, West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica, May 28, 2010

stories.title: South Africa brush aside hosts to take series
stories.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
stories.seoTitle: South Africa brush aside hosts to take series
stories.summary: South Africa wrapped up their sixth successive bilateral series against West Indies after their well-oiled pace machine steamrolled the home side on a barely responsive track in Dominica

image.longCaption: A powerful, unorthodox stroke from AB de Villiers, West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica, May 28, 2010

stories.summary: A spate of injuries to the home side has made South Africa even more likely to secure an early series victory

recentReportStory.title: South Africa brush aside hosts to take series
recentReportStory.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
recentReportStory.seoTitle: South Africa brush aside hosts to take series
recentReportStory.summary: South Africa wrapped up their sixth successive bilateral series against West Indies after their well-oiled pace machine steamrolled the home side on a barely responsive track in Dominica

image.caption: A powerful, unorthodox stroke from AB de Villiers
image.longCaption: A powerful, unorthodox stroke from AB de Villiers, West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica, May 28, 2010

recentPreviewStory.title: Weakened Windies face tough task
recentPreviewStory.subTitle: West Indies v South Africa, 3rd ODI, Dominica
recentPreviewStory.summary: A spate of injuries to the home side has made South Africa even more likely to secure an early series victory
